# equatags

<!-- badges: start -->
[![R build status](https://github.com/davidgohel/equatags/workflows/R-CMD-check/badge.svg)](https://github.com/davidgohel/equatags/actions)
[![Lifecycle: maturing](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-maturing-blue.svg)](https://www.tidyverse.org/lifecycle/#maturing)
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of the package is to provide a tool to transform equations expressed in
`latex`, `MathML` or `ASCIIMathML` into `SVG` format (i.e. as an image) and
`Office Open XML Math` format (which can be used in a Word or PowerPoint
document).

## Installation

You can install the development version from GitHub with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("davidgohel/equatags")
```
## Example

```{r results='asis', eval=(node_available() && mathjax_npm_available())}
library(equatags)
x <- c("(ax^2 + bx + c = 0)",
       "x = {-b \\pm \\sqrt{b^2-4ac} \\over 2a}")
z <- transform_mathjax(x = x, to = "svg")
cat(z, sep = "\n\n")
```
